intro: Montanoa macrolepis, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
